!compiz: what do I have to install to configure compiz in more detail?
there was some package for it, some gnome-compiz-config, or compiz-config-something...
make sure you have 3d accelleration (video drivers) installed then install compizconfig-settings-manager
the only difference between is the DE and WM, the rest is identical, you can install as many of these as you have space if you so wish
if you install kubuntu-desktop you can use gnome or kde, with a clean install youo willonly have 1
you will also be able to use the gnome apps in kde as you have the required libs to run them
the method you suggester removes 90 packages, but 190 were installed with kubuntu-desktop
thats all i know
